title: Thundershowers forecast for Northern, North-Central, Eastern Provinces, Matale today
byline: Due to a low pressure area over the southeast Bay of Bengal, thundershowers would occur in the Northern, North-Central and Eastern Provinces and in the Matale district and showers would occur at several places elsewhere in the island during the evening or night, the Meteorology Department said.

title: Thai vets consider trimming tusks of Muthu Raja to improve mobility
byline: Veterinarians at the Thai Elephant Conservation Centre in Lampang are planning to trim the tusks of Plai Sak Surin (Muthu Raja), the 29-year-old elephant that was brought back to Thailand from Sri Lanka, to help improve his quality of life.

title: Jayasuriya confident ahead of Sri Lanka-South Africa Test series
byline: Sri Lanka men’s cricket coach Sanath Jayasuriya yesterday that Sri Lankan players who preparing for the upcoming Test series against South Africa are well-prepared and fully committed to giving their best, despite lacking practice matches before the series which will commence on Wednesday (27) at Kingsmead Durban.

title: National consumer prices continue to decline by 0.7% in October on lower fuel prices
byline: Consumer prices measured by the National Consumer Prices Index fell further into negative territory in October after the index tipped into deflation in September due to repeatedly cut energy prices.

title: Sri Lanka to host first-ever marine summit ‘Voyage Sri Lanka 2024’
byline: Sri Lanka is gearing up to host its first-ever Marine Summit, titled Voyage Sri Lanka 2024, scheduled to take place at the Kingsbury Hotel in Colombo on November 26.  The event, organised by the Export Development Board (EDB) in collaboration with key stakeholders from the marine industry is aimed at emphasising Sri Lanka’s

title: Adani Group denies allegations against Gautam Adani
byline: The Adani Group has denied the allegations made by the US Department of Justice and the US Securities and Exchange Commission, in its indictment against Gautam Adani and seven others, calling the charges “baseless”.

title: Kenya drops over $2.5 billion of Adani deals after US indictment
byline: Kenyan President William Ruto said on Thursday he had ordered the cancellation of a procurement process that had been expected to award control of the country’s main airport to India’s Adani Group after its founder was indicted in the United States.

title: Tension erupts at UNP headquarters
byline: A tense situation was reported at the UNP party headquarters in Sirikotha when a group of UNP supporters arrived to hand over a document on reviving the party.

title: Two fishermen injured in explosion of floating parcel off Mannar coast
byline: Two fishermen were seriously injured and hospitalised after a parcel floating on the sea exploded while they were checking it off the coast of Mannar.

title: Romania to elect new President
byline: Romanian voters are called to the polls to elect a new head of state this Sunday. Pollsters believe the right-wing populist AUR candidate George Simion could make it to a runoff vote on December 8 against the Social Democratic Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu. Commentators zero in on Simion’s chances of winning.

title: ’’Caught in NPP’s Shramadana, but not buried’’: Harin
byline: Former Minister Harin Fernando said that although he was caught up in the NPP’s ’Shramadanaya’ during the election, he was not ’’buried’’ and is determined to rise again.

title: Prof. Udugamasooriya appointed Senior Advisor on Science and Technology
byline: Prof. Gomika Udugamasooriya has been appointed as the President’s Senior Advisor on Science and Technology.

title: NPP MP assures Parliament canteen will not be closed: Harsha
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva said today that an NPP MP has told him that the Parliament canteen will not be closed but the government will see that no one will abuse the facility.

title: Joint programme launched to address disasters during 2024 A/L exams
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) and the Examinations Department have initiated a joint programme to mitigate potential disasters during the 2024 Advanced Level examinations.

title: Sri Lanka elected to the UN Commission on International Trade Law
byline: Sri Lanka was among thirty-one (31) members elected to the United Nations Commission on International Trade Law (UNCITRAL) by the UN General Assembly, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said.

title: Netanyahu attacks ICC war crimes arrest warrants
byline: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has condemned as ’’antisemitic’’ a decision by the International Criminal Court to issue arrest warrants for war crimes against him and ex-Defence Minister Yoav Gallant.

title: Fire breaks out in a flat at Wellampitiya
byline: A fire broke out in a flat at the Salamulla housing scheme in Wellampitiya this morning, according to the Wellampitiya Police.

title: 10 killed in Sufi shrine attack in Afghanistan
byline: At least 10 people were killed after a gunman opened fire on Sufis who were taking part in a weekly ritual at a shrine in a remote area of Afghanistan’s Nahrin district.

title: Complaint filed against Jaffna MP
byline: A group of civil society activists has filed a complaint with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) against Dr. Archchuna Ramanathan, the newly elected independent MP for the Jaffna District.

title: Third review of debt restructuring with IMF concludes
byline: The discussions related to the third review of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) programme concluded today (22), the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Court orders digging up treasure
byline: Excavations were carried out amid torrential rain on court order in a location in Expressway road reservation near Wandurawa Rajamaha Vihara in Veyangoda on information that a treasure had been buried there, but it was postponed for today after no evidence of a treasure was found.
